definitions.definition: (provincial) To earn, earn by labor; earn money or one's living.
(provincial) To thrive or grow; to ripen.
To make addle; to grow addle; to muddle
To cause fertilised eggs to lose viability, by killing the developing embryo within through shaking, piercing, freezing or oiling, without breaking the shell.
(of eggs) Bad, rotten; inviable, containing a dead embryo.
Confused; mixed up.
Morbid, corrupt, putrid, or barren.
The light of a fire, such as from a campfire or fireplace.
Like something from a dream; having a sense of vagueness, insubstantiality, or incongruousness.
definitions.example: Her kiss sent me into a dreamlike state of bliss, and while we must have spent the next several hours wandering the fairground together, I can hardly remember any of it.

definitions.definition: A (mechanical) device to perform a certain task
A means, such as an elaborate plan or strategy, to accomplish a certain objective
Something overly artful or artificial
To smear or rub over with oil or an unctuous substance; also, to spread over, as oil.
To apply oil to or to pour oil upon, etc., as a sacred rite, especially for consecration.
To choose or nominate somebody for a leading or otherwise important position, especially formally or officially, or as an intended successor.
To mark somebody as an official ruler, especially a king or queen, as a part of a religious ceremony.
One who gives an anesthetic.
Seeds from grass that has become hay.
Cruft from bits of hay that sticks to clothing, etc.
A rustic person; a yokel or bumpkin.
Characteristic of a hayseed (person).
Someone who lives in or is familiar with the Australian outback; a bushman or bushwoman.
Something that cannot be observed.
That cannot be observed.
Within, or through the trachea
Incapable of being classified.
definitions.example: an unclassifiable mixture of comedy and drama

definitions.definition: The act of scattering or dispersing.
A collection of dispersed objects.
To (cause to) separate and go in different directions; to disperse.
definitions.example: The crowd scattered in terror.

definitions.definition: To distribute loosely as by sprinkling.
definitions.example: Her ashes were scattered at the top of a waterfall.

definitions.definition: To deflect (radiation or particles).
To occur or fall at widely spaced intervals.
To frustrate, disappoint, and overthrow.
definitions.example: to scatter hopes or plans

definitions.definition: To be dispersed upon.
definitions.example: Desiccated stalks scattered the fields.

definitions.definition: An inclination to escape from routine or reality into fantasy.
A genre of book, film etc. that one uses to indulge this tendency.
The performance of an escape artist.
A major repair, remake, renovation, or revision.
definitions.example: The engine required a complete overhaul to run properly.

definitions.definition: The process after the fire appears extinguished in which the firefighters search the structure for signs of hot spots that may cause the structure to reignite. Often this includes the process of salvage under the blanket term, salvage and overhaul.
To modernize, repair, renovate, or revise completely.
To pass, overtake, or travel past.
To keep (running rigging) clear, and see that no hitch occurs.
To search (a ship) for contraband goods.
To roll oneself about in something dirty, for example in mud.
definitions.example: Pigs wallow in the mud.

definitions.definition: To move lazily or heavily in any medium.
To immerse oneself in, to occupy oneself with, metaphorically.
definitions.example: She wallowed in her misery.

definitions.definition: To live or exist in filth or in a sickening manner.
To wither; to fade.
The act of one who wallows.
A sturdy sack filled with sand, generally used in large numbers to make defensive walls against flooding, bullets, or shrapnel.
A small bag filled with sand and used as a cudgel.
An engraver's leather cushion, etc.
A deceptive play whereby a player with a strong hand bets weakly or passively.
The area in front of a petrol station where the petrol pumps are situated.
Any open area in front of a building.
Something which hinders: something that holds back or causes problems with something else.
definitions.example: High-heeled shoes may be fashionable, but they can also be a hindrance to walking.

definitions.definition: The state or act of hindering something
definitions.example: Your hindrance of this process will not be tolerated.

definitions.definition: Strong in the face of fear; courageous.
Having any sort of superiority or excellence.
Making a fine show or display.
One who braves something.
definitions.example: a reckless braver of dangers

definitions.definition: Having a red colour; reddish
Of or pertaining to the erythrocytes, especially to their development
An erythroblast in its normal course of maturation.
A swift, witty reply, especially one that is amusing.
A conversation marked by a series of witty retorts.
Skill in replying swiftly and wittily.
To reply with a repartee
To have a repartee (conversation marked by repartees)
Either of the two grooves in a bow that hold the bowstring.
The notch at the rear of an arrow that fits on the bowstring.
The upper fore corner of a boom sail or trysail.
To fit an arrow against the bowstring of a bow or crossbow. (See also notch.)
To cut a nock in (usually in an arrow's base or the tips of a bow).
Any of several deciduous trees of the genus Celtis, widespread over the Northern Hemisphere, having small fruit.
The fruit of these plants.
The wood of these plants.
Prunus padus, a species of cherry tree, of Eurasia, or its berry.
To convert a continuous space into an equivalent discrete space, often for the purposes of easier calculation.
Subjected to discretization
Having the qualities of a bog; i.e. dank, squishy, muddy, and full of water and rotting vegetation.
definitions.example: The edge of the woods led out onto a noisome, boggy fen, a paradise for mosquitos and small frogs.

definitions.definition: A crossroad.
To separate one substance from another by means of a solvent; to wash; to cleanse.
definitions.example: A mixture of isooctane and ethyl acetate can be used to elute triglycerides from a complex lipid solution.

definitions.definition: To make the sound of a chime.
definitions.example: I got up for lunch as soon as the wall clock began chiming noon.

definitions.definition: To cause to sound in harmony; to play a tune, as upon a set of bells; to move or strike in harmony.
To utter harmoniously; to recite rhythmically.
To agree; to correspond.
definitions.example: The other lab's results chimed with mine, so I knew we were on the right track with the research.

definitions.definition: To make a rude correspondence of sounds; to jingle, as in rhyming.
An instance of chiming; a sound that chimes.
Exhibiting dissonance; not agreeing or harmonizing.
definitions.example: The music was filled with dissonant chords.

definitions.definition: Insight into the true nature of reality, namely as the three marks of existence: impermanence, suffering or unsatisfactoriness, and the realisation of nonself.
A native or inhabitant of the north of a region (or of the world as a whole), such as one of the northern United States, the north of Norway, etc.
The study of genes that code for enzymes that metabolize drugs, and the design of tailor-made drugs adapted to an individual's genetic make-up.
The process of applying a signal to a carrier, modulating.
The variation and regulation of a population, physiological response, etc.
A change in key.
To combine two or more things to produce a new product.
(of two or more things) To be combined producing a new, more complex product.
To produce a substance by chemical synthesis.
(of a substance) To be produced by chemical synthesis.
A person who loves humankind in general.
A very generous person or institution.
A colloidal aggregate, in a simple geometric form, of a specific number of amphipathic molecules which forms at a well-defined concentration, called the critical micelle concentration
The condition of having unkempt hair, generally as a result of having just woken up from sleep.
A vertical panel or board at the end of a bed where the pillow is placed.
The end of a bed where the pillow is placed, the head of the bed.
The process, in the regulation of gene expression, in which the number, or activity of receptors increases in order to increase sensitivity
To do something harmful or negative to get revenge for some harm; to fight back or respond in kind to an injury or affront.
definitions.example: John insulted Peter to retaliate for Peter's acid remark earlier.

definitions.definition: To repay or requite by an act of the same kind.
To start (an institution or organization).
To begin building.
To melt, especially of metal in an industrial setting.
To form by melting a metal and pouring it into a mould; to cast.
A thin, single-cut file for comb-makers.
Any of various deciduous trees of the genus Populus.
Wood from the poplar tree.
The act of deflecting or something deflected.
The deviation of a needle or other indicator from its previous position.
Any of several species of fish of the genus Thunnus in the family Scombridae.
The edible flesh of the tuna.
The prickly pear, a type of cactus native to Mexico in the genus Opuntia.
The fruit of the cactus.
To have the vomiting reflex triggered.
An imitation of the sound of gagging, used to express disgust or disdain.
definitions.example: Blech! Look at all those maggots!

definitions.definition: A metal sheet used to cover stovetop burners on Shabbat to allow food to be kept warm without violating the prohibition against cooking.
Of or pertaining to a knight or knights.
Befitting a knight; formally courteous (as a knight); chivalrous, gallant and courtly.
definitions.example: knightly combat

definitions.definition: In the manner of a knight; chivalrously.
One who debates or participates in a debate; one who argues.
definitions.example: William is a great debater.

definitions.definition: Women's hats.
A shop selling women's hats.
The business and work that a milliner engages in.
To transfer a widescreen motion picture to home video formats while preserving the original aspect ratio, with the placing of black bars above and below the picture area.
To hunt for letterboxes (containers with logbook and rubber stamp) by following clues.
In an irresistible manner.
To exert oneself.
To attempt through application of effort (to do something); to try strenuously.
To attempt (something).
To work with purpose.
The act by which one endeavors or strives; an attempt.
In a comical manner
A layer that lies underneath another.
The underlying cause or basis of something.
A substrate.
A small cetacean of the family Phocoenidae, related to dolphins and whales.
(imprecisely) Any small dolphin.
Said of an air-breathing aquatic animal such as a porpoise or penguin: To repeatedly jump out of the water to take a breath and dive back in a continuous motion.
Said of an aircraft: to make a series of plunges when taking off or landing; or of a watercraft: to successively plunge up and down in the water.
An article of protective clothing that is designed to keep the wearer's head floating above the surface of the water.
Resembling a block in shape.
definitions.example: The oldest video games had crude, blocky graphics.

definitions.definition: An arboreal anthropoid ape genus Pongo consisting of two species, Pongo pygmaeus of Borneo and Pongo abelii of Sumatra, having a shaggy reddish-brown coat, long arms, and no tail.
Of any representation, especially pictures, statues: The same size as the real thing.
definitions.example: Many consider the life-size painting of King Peter to be one of the artist's best works.

definitions.definition: An airy pudding served chilled, particularly chocolate mousse.
A savory dish, of meat or seafood, containing gelatin.
definitions.example: ham mousse

definitions.definition: A styling cream used for hair.
definitions.example: He slicked his hair back with mousse, but the cowlick still stuck up.

definitions.definition: A stable emulsion of water and oil that is created by wave action churning the water where an oil spill occurs.
To apply mousse (styling cream).
definitions.example: He moussed his hair in the morning and then washed it out at night.

definitions.definition: To successfully convince (someone) to agree to, accept, or do something, usually through reasoning and verbal influence.
definitions.example: That salesman was able to persuade me into buying this bottle of lotion.

definitions.definition: To convince of by argument, or by reasons offered or suggested from reflection, etc.; to cause to believe (something).
To urge, plead; to try to convince (someone to do something).
(of a person) Fastidious and fussy; difficult to please; exacting, especially about details.
definitions.example: My editor is very finicky about punctuation. Every dot and comma has to be just right.

definitions.definition: Demanding; requiring above-normal care.
definitions.example: The lawnmower is a bit finicky in cold weather.

definitions.definition: To expel; to remove.
definitions.example: The protesters became so noisy that they were finally ousted from the meeting.

definitions.definition: The act by which somebody is ousted.
A prisoner sentenced to life in prison.
A prisoner sentenced to transportation for life.
A person with a singular career path, especially in the military.
A bird species seen for the first time by a birder who is keeping a list of all the species he or she has ever seen.
A Greek long-necked plucked fretted lute having a sharp, metallic sound
Reticle.
A logarithmic function that has a normal distribution.
Describing a logarithmic function that has a normal distribution.
A relationship of mutual trust and respect. A close and harmonious relationship in which the people or groups concerned understand each other's feelings or ideas and communicate well.
definitions.example: He always tried to maintain a rapport with his customers.

definitions.definition: Relation; proportion; conformity.
To presage, or suggest something in advance.
Someone who nibbles.
A tool for cutting sheet metal.
A fish of the sea chub subfamily Girellinae.
A kind of program for copying protected floppy disks.
The state or quality of being meek.
(grammar, of a verb) not transitive: not having, or not taking, a direct object
definitions.example: The word "drink" is a transitive verb in "they drink wine", but an intransitive one in "they drink often."

definitions.definition: Not transitive or passing further; kept; detained
Collectively, the tasks involved with cleaning a house; the practice of cleaning a house.
definitions.example: If you do not keep up with the housecleaning, you will soon have a huge mess.

definitions.definition: To clean the interior and furnishings of a residence.
To make major reforms; to clean house.
To clean the interior and residential furnishings of.
To rid of undesirable personnel and procedures.
In context of possibility of being heard; in an audible manner.
The quality or state of being invincible; invincibleness.
A card game, similar to bezique.
A meld of the jack of diamonds and queen of spades in that card game.
A polyphenol (1E,6E)-1,7-bis(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)hepta-1,6-diene-3,5-dione; a major constituent of the spice turmeric.
Covered by dew.
definitions.example: The dewy grass was too slick for football.

definitions.definition: Having the quality of bearing droplets of water.
definitions.example: In the dewy fog, it was cold and damp.

definitions.definition: Fresh and innocent.
The reestablishment of cordial relations, particularly between two countries; a reconciliation.
definitions.example: It was the Nixon administration that saw the rapprochement between the United States and China.

definitions.definition: A kind of canopy bed draped with a baldacchin.
A stately Polish dance in triple time and moderate tempo.
Music for this dance.
A woman's dress having a tight bodice and a skirt divided to show a coloured underskirt.
A short overcoat bordered with fur.
A garnish made with melted butter, breadcrumbs and herbs.
To dance the polonaise.
(of property, people or situations at risk) to rescue.
(of discarded goods) to put to use.
To make new or restore for the use of being saved.
The act by which something is salvaged.
In an oblique manner; sideways.
In an uneasy manner.
To measure.
(usually with “out”) To dispense, measure (out), allot (especially punishment, reward etc.).
Someone or something that discharges something, such as pollution or a firearm
Beyond what is customary or proper; extravagant.
Very unconventional.
Another time; once more.
Over and above a factor of one.
Used metalinguistically, with the repetition being in the discussion, or in the linguistic or pragmatic context of the discussion, rather than in the subject of discussion.
definitions.example: Great, thanks again!

definitions.definition: Back in the reverse direction, or to an original starting point.
definitions.example: Bring us word again.

definitions.definition: Back (to a former place or state).
definitions.example: The South will rise again.

definitions.definition: In return, as a reciprocal action; back.
In any other place.
On the other hand.
Moreover; besides; further.
In a contrary direction to.
definitions.example: It is hard work to swim against the current.

definitions.definition: In physical opposition to; in collision with.
definitions.example: The rain pounds against the window.

definitions.definition: In physical contact with, so as to abut or be supported by.
definitions.example: The kennel was put against the back wall.

definitions.definition: Close to, alongside.
definitions.example: A row of trees stood against a fence.

definitions.definition: In front of; before (a background).
definitions.example: The giant was silhouetted against the door.

definitions.definition: In contrast or comparison with.
definitions.example: He stands out against his classmates.

definitions.definition: In competition with, versus.
definitions.example: The Tigers will play against the Bears this weekend.

definitions.definition: Contrary to; in conflict with.
definitions.example: Doing this is against my principles.

definitions.definition: In opposition to.
definitions.example: Are you against freedom of choice?

definitions.definition: Of betting odds, denoting a worse-than-even chance.
definitions.example: That horse is fifty-to-one against, so it has virtually no chance of winning.

definitions.definition: In exchange for.
definitions.example: The vouchers are redeemable against West End shows and theatre breaks.

definitions.definition: As counterbalance to.
As a charge on.
definitions.example: Tax is levied against income from sales.

definitions.definition: As protection from.
definitions.example: He turned the umbrella against the wind.

definitions.definition: In anticipation of; in preparation for (a particular time, event etc.).
definitions.example: The stores are kept well stocked against a time of need.

definitions.definition: (Hollywood) To be paid now in contrast to the following amount to be paid later under specified circumstances, usually that a movie is made or has started filming.
definitions.example: The studio weren't sure the movie would ever get made, so they only paid $50,000 against $200,000. That way they wouldn't be out very much if filming never began.

definitions.definition: Exposed to.
A division into two branches.
(by extension) Any place where one thing divides into two.
The act of bifurcating; branching or dividing in two.
Either of the forks or other branches resultant from such a division.
A place where two roads, tributaries etc. part or meet.
The point where a channel divides when proceeding from seaward.
The change in the qualitative or topological structure of a given family as described by bifurcation theory.
A command that executes one block or other of commands depending on the result of a condition.
A wrestling bout.
A struggle.
To drive away, disperse.
To use up or waste; squander.
To vanish by dispersion.
To cause energy to be lost through its conversion to heat.
To be dissolute in conduct.
Any of several glycoproteins found in mucus
A pause or halt of some activity.
Something that forms an obstacle to continued activity; a blockage or obstruction.
The visible underside of an arch, balcony, beam, cornice, staircase, vault or any other architectural element.
(pipe technology) The top point of the inside open section of a pipe or box conduit.
definitions.example: The elevation of the pipe soffit is 10.4 meters above mean sea level.

definitions.definition: (originally rhetorical) A rhetorical device in which a series is arranged in ascending order.
An instance of such an ascending series.
The culmination of a narrative's rising action, the turning point.
(now commonly) A culmination or acme: the last term in an ascending series, particularly:
To reach or bring to a climax.
To orgasm; to reach orgasm.
An ordinary (geometric design) in the shape of an X. It usually occupies the entire field in which it is placed.
The Saint Andrew's cross, the flag of Scotland.
A master-at-arms onboard a Royal Navy ship
Airy; showy; finical.
(by extension) Characterized by an affected or fantastical manner.
Dapper or stylish.
definitions.example: He wore a jaunty outfit that was all the rage.

definitions.definition: Ostentatiously self-confident.
definitions.example: He walked down the street with a jaunty swaggering step, as if daring others less perfectly satisfied to intrude upon his good mood.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to starch.
Containing starch.
Having the quality of fabric starch as applied to fabric; stiff, hard; starched.
Having a starched personality; stiffly formal.
A very large wine bottle with the capacity of about 12 liters, equivalent to 16 standard bottles.
Easily bothered or upset; tending to be nauseated or nervous; oversensitive
definitions.example: He might have made a good doctor, had he not been so squeamish about the sight of blood.

definitions.definition: Averse or reluctant
The branch of horticulture concerned with the planting and growth of trees.
A long sled without runners, with the front end curled upwards, which may be pulled across snow by a cord or used to coast down hills.
A similar sled of wood, pulled by dogs, possibly with steel runners, made to transport cargo.
Something which, once it starts going (figuratively) downhill, is unstoppable until it reaches the bottom.
(especially South Carolina, West Virginia) A knit cap, designed to provide warmth in cold weather.
To slide down a hill on a toboggan or other object.
To go downhill unstoppably until one reaches the bottom.
One who studies zoology.
Any single-stranded DNA virus, of the genus Parvovirus, being the smallest found in nature; they infect only mammals other than humans.
Certain small viruses, not in genus Parvovirus, that infect humans.
The act or process of finalising.
A considerable lump, scoop, or quantity of something, especially soft food.
definitions.example: Each pancake comes with a dollop of suspiciously soft butter in a tiny plastic cup.

definitions.definition: To apply haphazardly in generous lumps or scoops.
definitions.example: She dolloped a generous quantity of mustard on her hot dog.

definitions.definition: To dole out in a considerable quantity; to drip in a viscous form.
(sometimes countable) An anticipatory response to expected changes in the environment of a system
To respond in advance
Crazy; silly; ridiculous
definitions.example: That's a screwy idea; I am not going to fly all the way to Antarctica just to see a penguin!

definitions.definition: Tipsy; slightly drunk.
Exacting; extortionate; close.
Worthless.
Either of two airways, which are primary branches of the trachea, leading directly into the lungs.
The quality of being eccentric or odd; any eccentric behaviour.
The ratio, constant for any particular conic section, of the distance of a point from the focus to its distance from the directrix.
definitions.example: For an ellipse, the eccentricity is the ratio of the distance from the center to a focus divided by the length of the semi-major axis.

definitions.definition: The eccentricity of the conic section (usually an ellipse) defined by the orbit of a given object around a reference object (such as that of a planet around the sun).
To make (something) deviate from its original path.
(ball games) To touch the ball, often unwittingly, after a shot or a sharp pass, thereby making it unpredictable for the other players.
To deviate from its original path.
To avoid addressing (questions, criticism, etc.).
definitions.example: The Prime Minister deflected some increasingly pointed questions by claiming he had an appointment.

definitions.definition: To divert (attention, etc.).
A person who is easily made to bleed, or who bleeds in unusually large amounts, particularly a hemophiliac.
A blood vessel that requires cauterization etc. to stop it from bleeding during surgery.
Anything that saps a resource produced by something else.
A valve designed to release a small amount of excess pressure from a system.
A troublesome fellow; a blighter.
A person who spends a great deal of time playing video games.
Any of various edible European bivalve mollusks, of the family Cardiidae, having heart-shaped shells.
The shell of such a mollusk.
(in the plural) One’s innermost feelings (only in the expression “the cockles of one’s heart”).
(directly from French coquille) A wrinkle, pucker
(by extension) A defect in sheepskin; firm dark nodules caused by the bites of keds on live sheep
The mineral black tourmaline or schorl.
The fire chamber of a furnace.
A kiln for drying hops; an oast.
The dome of a heating furnace.
Any of several field weeds, such as the common corncockle (Agrostemma githago) and darnel ryegrass (Lolium temulentum).
A £10 note; a tenner.
To cause to contract into wrinkles or ridges, as some kinds of cloth after a wetting; to pucker.
An antifungal drug used especially against Candida
A small bag, especially a small, clear, plastic bag.
A small plastic bag, as for sandwiches.
The quality of being, or having potential.
An inherent capacity for growth or development.
An aptitude amenable to development; capability.
Indeterminism.
Quantum indeterminacy.
An increase in the severity of something (such as a disease)
The child of one's spouse but not one's own.
A bereaved child; one who has lost father or mother.
A lighter-than-air aircraft that can be propelled forward through the air as well as steered.
definitions.example: Airships are posited to be cheaper to operate over time than fixed-wing aircraft, but as there are no large fleets, this is hard to prove in practice.

definitions.definition: Any aircraft.
definitions.example: On weekends, I liked to spend my time at the airport watching the various airships take off and land.

definitions.definition: The highest ranking officials of the RAF, viewed as arrogant and distant.
A lace used for fastening a shoe.
To assume some truth without proof, usually for the purpose of reaching a conclusion based on that truth.
To use cursing, to use bad language, to speak profanely.
The act of one who cusses, or uses bad language.
An attempt to assume or exhibit what is not natural or real; false display; artificial show.
An unusual mannerism.
An angle or part that reenters itself.
One who enters (the labour market, etc.) again.
A valley between a pair of parallel ridges
Reentering; pointing inward.
(of a mutual exclusion mechanism) Such that the corresponding lock can be reacquired by the locking thread.
definitions.example: The global interpreter lock of the embedded scripting engine is not reentrant.

definitions.definition: That may be executed more than once at a time either by different threads, or because of recursion.
definitions.example: Global variables must not be altered by reentrant code.

definitions.definition: (of a part of a rocket) Designed to return to the Earth's atmosphere.
Of or pertaining to reentry (in the heart)
(of a ukulele or similar instrument) Having the strings not ordered according to pitch (having a re-entry)
An unsteady flash of light.
definitions.example: the flicker of a poorly tuned television set

definitions.definition: A short moment.
Any of certain small woodpeckers, especially of the genus Colaptes.
One who flicks.
To burn or shine unsteadily, or with a wavering light.
To keep going on and off; to appear and disappear for short moments; to flutter.
To flutter; to flap the wings without flying.
An agent that prevents, stops, or lessens convulsions.
(pharmaceutical effect) Acting as an anticonvulsant.
(Pueblo culture) A vaguely ancestral anthropomorphic spirit being, associated with clouds and rain or personifying the power in the sun, the earth or corn (among other things).
(Pueblo culture) A wooden doll, as might be given to a child, which represents such a being.
(Pueblo culture) A masked dancer who represents such a being in a ceremonial dance or masked ceremony.
To disclaim and expel from the family, as a father his child; to disown; to disinherit.
To formally separate oneself from or to divest oneself of.
To depose.
To reject; to cast off; to discard.
To surrender, renounce or relinquish, as sovereign power; to withdraw definitely from filling or exercising, as a high office, station, dignity; to fail to fulfill responsibility for.
definitions.example: Note: The word abdicate was held to mean, in the case of James II, to abandon without a formal surrender.

definitions.definition: To relinquish or renounce a throne, or other high office or dignity; to renounce sovereignty.
The sound produced by anything that creaks; a creaking.
To make a prolonged sharp grating or squeaking sound, as by the friction of hard substances.
To produce a creaking sound with.
To suffer from strain or old age.
To frame again.
definitions.example: The woman in the shop was reframing a painting.

definitions.definition: To redescribe, from a different perspective; to relabel.
definitions.example: The military reframed tedium as duty.

definitions.definition: Framing anew or again.
A zigzag path, road or railway track; especially a railway track in which the train travels in a reverse direction at each switch
A hairpin bend.
A roller coaster.
A route with alternate sharp ascents and descents.
(of a path etc) To zigzag.
